intro: Vernonia santacruzensis, commonly known as Santa Cruz ironweed, is a flowering plant native to the United States, specifically found in California. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky areas, preferring well-drained soils. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its flowers are small and clustered in dense, spiky heads. Vernonia santacruzensis is known for its resilience and ability to thrive in arid conditions.
